title: Dahanu Beach
subtitle: A Peaceful Coastal Haven of Palghar District
overview: Dahanu Beach, located in the Palghar district of Maharashtra, is a tranquil and less-crowded stretch of the Arabian Sea coast known for its pristine sands and serene ambiance.

Surrounded by chikoo (sapodilla) orchards and tall coconut palms, Dahanu offers a refreshing blend of coastal charm and rural Konkan beauty. The beach is also famous for its mild climate and clean waters, making it a favored weekend getaway from Mumbai.
It’s an ideal destination for those seeking peace, long walks, and glimpses of traditional Warli tribal art and culture nearby.

highlights.title: Chikoo Orchards
highlights.description: Dahanu is renowned for its vast chikoo farms, adding a fragrant sweetness to the coastal breeze.

highlights.title: Warli Art & Culture
highlights.description: Explore the nearby villages to experience the famous Warli tribal paintings and lifestyle.

geography.intro: Dahanu lies around 120 km north of Mumbai along the Mumbai–Ahmedabad Highway. The region forms part of the North Konkan coastal belt, characterized by lush greenery, orchards, and sandy shores.

climate.description: Dahanu enjoys a moderate coastal climate throughout the year, with cool sea breezes and warm days.

seasons.text: Best time to visit: October to March
Monsoon months (June–September) bring lush greenery but limited water activities

geography.conclusion: Dahanu’s peaceful setting and cultural flavor make it a perfect destination for eco-tourism and relaxation.

activities.title: Beach Walks & Relaxation
activities.description: Stroll along the long stretch of soft sands and enjoy the calm sea breeze.
info: Early mornings and sunsets are most scenic

activities.title: Chikoo Farm Visits
activities.description: Experience local life and taste fresh chikoo fruits in nearby farms.
info: Guided tours available at select orchards
Best in December–February during harvest season

activities.title: Warli Art Trail
activities.description: Visit nearby Warli villages to see traditional art on huts and walls.
info: Local artists often sell hand-painted souvenirs

attractions.title: Dahanu Fort
attractions.description: A historic 16th-century fort built by the Portuguese, now serving as a reminder of Dahanu’s colonial past.

attractions.title: Bordi Beach
attractions.description: A nearby, equally serene beach often combined with Dahanu in tourist circuits.

marineLife.intro: Dahanu’s clean coastal ecosystem supports small fish species, crabs, and marine vegetation near the shore.

items.title: Local Fisheries
items.description: Small-scale fishing forms an important part of local livelihood.

items.title: Tidal Diversity
items.description: During low tide, shells and crabs can be easily spotted along the shore.

conclusion: Marine life here is modest but well-balanced due to low industrial activity.
Responsible tourism helps maintain its ecological purity.

howToReach.title: By Train
details: Nearest railway station: Dahanu Road (Western Railway line)
Auto rickshaws and local taxis available from the station (2 km from beach)

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Located 120 km from Mumbai via NH48 and Dahanu–Charoti Road
Regular buses and private vehicles available from Palghar and Mumbai

bookingTips.description: Choose from beachside cottages or chikoo farm stays for a unique experience.
Try local seafood and traditional Warli cuisine.
Book early during winter weekends as it’s a popular eco-getaway.
